Case reference: 2015011636.CaseDesc: On June 20, 1998, a fisherman saw the body of a man floating in the St. Lawrence River in front of L'île aux Vaches.

Socks: White, Grey, white top and gray on bottom
Tattoo: Right Shoulder, sword and a cross

Case reference: 2006012299.CaseDesc: On June 02, 1984, Andrew Grinnell, his brother,their cousin and a friend  departed Sioux Lookout on a canoe trip on the Albany River. The party arrived in Fort Albany on July 18, 1984. At 6:00 p.m. that same day, the party decided to leave Fort Albany in an attempt to paddle to Moosonee via James Bay. The group had planned to go out onto James Bay with the tide and sail to Moosonee by lashing their canoes together. An intense storm engulfed the James Bay coastal area on July 23, 1984, and it is likely that the party perished on the Bay during this storm. Three victims were recovered in August 1984, twelve nautical miles North of the Moose River. Mr. Grinnell's body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2014004240.CaseDesc: Sheilagh Coleman was reported missing on August 22, 2000 by her mother. Her mother last saw her on August 1, 2000 when she visited her in Gibsons, B.C. The last reliable sighting of Sheilagh was believed to be August 21, 2000 by a neighbour. They saw her leaving the residence of her boyfriend on her bicycle. Numerous people were interviewed that were associated to her and was much contradiction regarding the dates and events in order of which Sheilagh was last seen.

Case reference: 2006017999.CaseDesc: Agnes Battersby was visiting a friend in Barrie, Ontario; who then drove her home around 1:30 a.m. on July 28, 1968. She was unable to walk very far due to her disability. She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2008021099.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1966, Diane Prevost was seen for the last time as she was camping at Grundy Provincial Park in Britt, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Diane had been playing on the beach, and had told her father that she wanted to go back to the campsite. When her father turned to do so, she was gone.

Shirt: Blue, Red, checked top with red at cuffs and collar

Case reference: 2006004799.CaseDesc: Ralph Monague and Curtis Smith were passengers on the Christian Island Ferry travelling between Cedar Point and Christian Island on December 22, 1985, when they fell over board in stormy conditions.

Case reference: 2006007499.CaseDesc: David Goetz and Lucas Zenger were last seen on August 23, 1992, in the Owen Sound area. They went for a canoe ride.  They travelled down the shoreline along Kepple Township, towards Big Bay. The canoe was located approximately 1.5 miles off Cape Commodore.

Case reference: 2020011625.CaseDesc: On or around January 15, 1975, John Hovey was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018063463.CaseDesc: During the last week of November in 1992, Slavko Orasnin was seen for the last time by his landlord in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2015066565.CaseDesc: George Wood was last seen in Surrey BC, on June 20, 2015 by family. At the time George Wood was reported missing, he was unemployed and of no fixed address living on the streets in Burnaby BC. His absence and not keeping in touch with family is out of character.

Belt: Black, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Black belt with large silver buckle
Scar: Right Arm, Long scar on right arm

Case reference: 2014003364.CaseDesc: On June 27, 1992, Heather Miller was reported missing by her boyfriend. Ms. Miller was believed to live a transient lifestyle, and could have traveled between Vancouver, BC, Merritt, BC, California, USA, and possibly as far as Australia.

Case reference: 2014004447.CaseDesc: On October 13th, 2002, Yvonne King was reported missing from the community of Fox Harbour, Placentia Bay. KING was last seen walking in the community.

Case reference: 2017074234.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2016 an unidentified male believed to be between the ages of 40 to 75 years old was discovered in Jayfield Park in Brampton, Ontario.

Case reference: 2008003599.CaseDesc: Charlie Campbell was last seen November 6, 1988 in Red Lake Ontario.  It is believed that he drowned.

Case reference: 2014004253.CaseDesc: On October 13, 2000, two boats were on the Churchill River headed to Granville Lake. One of the boats began taking on water and experiencing motor problems. Most of the occupants of the disabled boat boarded another boat. Mr. Linklater however stayed on the disabled boat attempting to start it. The missing boat was located the next day, however Mr. Linklater was not aboard. He is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2014001028.CaseDesc: The body of this middle aged man was found in the Fraser River near Quesnel, British Columbia on May 20, 1968. He was well dressed and had custom orthotic supports in his shoes. He would have been born around 1920, had grey hair and likely had full dentures.

Other: Case, Leather case with nail clippers
Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Pen Knife, Pen Knife
Leather, Black, Small key case with 15 keys
Wallet: Brown, Light brown leather wallet with dark brown stitching
Shoes: Leather, Black, Pointed dress shoe with Dr.Scholl's arch support insole

Case reference: 2014006268.CaseDesc: On September 25, 2013, Brandon Jakobek was seen for the last time flying a plane from Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario. Brandon, a Morningstar Air pilot and avid skydiver, had flown in from Toronto to deliver parcels for FedEx. He had informed employees prior to his departure that a warning light had illuminated during his flight and that he needed to run some diagnostic checks. The plane was never found and is thought to be in the Hudson Bay.

Case reference: 2016069136.CaseDesc:
This left lower arm and hand were recovered from the CPR rail yard in Windsor on March 25, 2014. The partial limb is from a young adult male who has brown skin. There are numerous tattoos present, most of which do not appear to have been professionally done. While the limbs appear to have been separated from the body after death, there is the possibility that the person remains alive. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be days to months.
Remains located in the CPR Freight Yard in Windsor on a lesser used track.  Biographic ancestry testing predicts person of Americas or mixed Americas and European Ancestry.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Unrecognizable designs of partial tattoos

Case reference: 2017056443.CaseDesc: Kristina Ward is a 20 years old aboriginal female who has been missing since September 27, 2017. Kristina is schizophrenic and is possibly using drugs. Kristina is developmentally delayed and is described as being vulnerable and easily trust people she does not know.  Kristina has money and a cellphone, however, neither have been used or accessed since September 27, 2017. Kristina was last seen in Surrey at the intersection of 104th Avenue and 144th St. with an unidentified male.

Mark: Upper Lip, Birthmark on upper left lip

Case reference: 2016070214.CaseDesc: On July 30, 1975, the remains of a female were discovered in the North Saskatchewan River near the Beverly area of Edmonton, Alberta. The individual had had extensive dental work and had an ‘X’ shaped scar on her left wrist.

Shoes: White, Blue, RUNNERS, White with blue stripe around upper edge of sole
Sweater: White, Pink, White with horizontal pink stripes
Pants: Nylon, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, PANTY HOSE

Case reference: 2005004799.CaseDesc: On February 17, 1991, an unidentified man was found floating in Lake Ontario, near 'Captain John's Boat Restaurant' on Queens Quay, west of Yonge Street near the Harbour Castle Hotel. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 166 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His skin was brown, perhaps suggesting a Middle Eastern, East Indian or North African ethnic affiliation. He had a wide nose and long slim fingers. His appendix was present and he was circumcised.

Hair: Black, Curly, Wavy, Hair shorter than collar; he had fine stubble on his face
Teeth: His teeth were in good condition with no restorations.
Money: $10.07 was found in bills and coin in his right front pocket
Shoes: Canvas, White, Cana Sport, running shoes; size 9 with white soles, LOT #21753
Belt: Brown, a narrow, light brown belt with a metal end
Underwear: Blue, Mr. Brief, jockey style; white waistband
Pants: Denim, Black, Levi's, size 33-34 with a button fly
Scar: Forehead, fine scars across his forehead
Head, fine scars between his eyebrows
Chin, small scars under his chin

Case reference: 2014004724.CaseDesc: On November 20, 2004, Corey Braun traveled from Fort St. John, B.C. to attend his employer's Christmas Party held at the Peace Valley Inn in Peace River, Alberta. On November 21, 2004, at 3:00 a.m., Corey was last seen walking to his room at the Peace Valley Inn by fellow employees. Corey has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Denim, Blue, light blue jean jacket

Case reference: 2014005999.CaseDesc: On February 5, 2013, at approximately 3:00 p.m., Quincy Blackburn was seen for the last time when his sister dropped him off at the Toronto Person International Airport in Toronto, Ontario. Quincy boarded a flight to Trinidad and was scheduled to return on February 19, but did not board the flight.

Pants: Red, White, TRACK, Track pants; Brand: Adidas
Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Earrings, Square diamond earrings

Case reference: 2014004993.CaseDesc: On the 5th of July, 2002, Percy McKenzie was last seen near Powell Island on Lac La Ronge lake, La Ronge, Saskatchewan. Mr. McKenzie was alone and the lake was very rough at the time. Searches failed to locate Percy McKenzie.

Case reference: 2018040311.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2003, Karanjeet Singh was seen for the last time as he left with some of his personal belongings to go visit a friend in Toronto, Ontario. Karanjeet was visiting Toronto from India and was due to return on May 24.

Case reference: 2014002843.CaseDesc: A party of 6 men departed Churchill, Manitoba, on a fishing trip traveling in three canoes. On June 20, 1967, two of the three canoes became stranded on mud flats at a point where the Hayes and Nelson Rivers empty into the Hudson Bay. The men made camp for the night and then the following day Kurt Hild, Ronald Davidson and James Cochrane all attempted to retrieve the stranded canoes. On return to the camp the men were confronted with high winds and freezing rain which forced them out of sight. None of the remains of the men have been recovered. Foul play is not suspected in the matter.

Case reference: 2009004899.CaseDesc: Sacha Latulippe left Montreal Airport for Mexico city on October 15, 2009. He advised his family he was leaving for business. Investigation revealed he had 2 wives in different towns and was leading a “double life”. He left with his business partner Eric Marcel on this same flight. Mr. Marcel is also missing.

Hair: Blonde, Brush Cut, Spikey/gelled, natural brown; Sideburns

Case reference: 2014006199.CaseDesc: Albert RIDDY went missing from his residence between April 5 and July 30, 2013. He has not been located since. The circumstances of his disappearance are considered suspicious.

Case reference: 2014001445.CaseDesc: On July 13, 1992, Howard Scott was last seen in Calgary, Alberta. Howard was travelling in his red 1985 Ford LTD Station Wagon from Calgary and was destined to return to Richmond, British Columbia. On August 15, 1992, Howard’s abandoned vehicle was located in a heavily wooded logging road near Moyie, British Columbia.  Howard has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2018045881.CaseDesc: In July of 2018 Tatianna Cuevas was taken on vacation by her father John Varga from Toronto, Ontario to Paris, France. It is the belief that she was abducted by her father as they have not returned to Canada on the agreed upon date.

Case reference: 2006008299.CaseDesc: Richard Rollo jumped out of his boat into Muskrat Lake, near Gull Rock, Cobden, Ontario in 1997 and never resurfaced.  He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014001408.CaseDesc: On September 13th, 1997, two fishermen failed to show up at their final destination and as a result they were reported missing to police. An immediate search of the lake was conducted and one of the men was found alive on a island. HUNTER was never found.

Case reference: 1987203340.CaseDesc: Joanne Pedersen went missing on February 19, 1983, near her home at Vedder Crossing (Chilliwack). She was last seen with an adult male at a telephone booth.

Case reference: 2014003009.CaseDesc: On the evening of September 30, 1979, Adolphe Thorassie and three hunting partners were attempting to return home after a successful hunt. Two men were in each boat. On the return trip the men had to go to shore once to get out of the winds. They again departed despite the high winds on the lake which was causing the water to be extremely dangerous with high waves. Adolphe was in the lead boat with his hunting partner, and unbeknownst to him the second boat had to return to shore for motor repairs. Adolphe and his hunting partner never returned and were reported missing the next day. The body of Adolphe's hunting partner was discovered and the cause of death was determined to be drowning. It is assumed Mr. Thorassie also drowned.

Case reference: 2014004569.CaseDesc: In August 1966, Philomene (Tiger) Lemay was socializing at a local bar in Slave Lake.  She was last seen very intoxicated.  Mrs. Lemay may have left with one or two men, possibly Americans, in the early evening.

Case reference: 1996003690.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1994, Angela Arseneault was reported missing by her common law spouse. She was last seen on August 19, 1994, they and another male went shopping. Later that day, Angela left to catch a bus home alone. When her common law spouse returned home, the lights were on in the apartment, a window was left open and Angela’s purse was in the kitchen. Angela has not been seen since.

Tattoo: Left Ankle, rose and stem (6 inches long)

Case reference: 2021000674.CaseDesc: On December 30, 2020, Tyler Desorcy was seen for the last time in the 900 block of Pandora Avenue in Victoria, British Columbia. Tyler has no fixed address and he has not been seen or heard from by his family, which is out of character for him.  Tyler is known to walk with a notable limp.

Hair: Brown, Dark brown receeding hair with some facial hair

Case reference: 2022059675.CaseDesc: On November 24, 2022, at approximately 10: 00 p.m, Rebecca Fudge-Schnarr was seen for the last time at her family’s residence in Iroquois Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018012254.CaseDesc: On March 5, 2018, at approximately 10:50am, Mary Owusu was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Blue, Parka with a fur trimmed hood

Case reference: 2021003909.CaseDesc: On April 6, 2018, Rita Squalli and Maria Squalli were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Rita and Maria were taken by their father under false pretences, and it is believed that the girls are being kept overseas.

Case reference: 2019007755.CaseDesc: On February 13, 2019, Thomas, ‘Tommy’, Jones was seen for the last time travelling in a car with a male acquaintance around the community of Grand Falls-Windsor, Newfoundland. When Thomas did not return home later that evening, he was reported missing. According to the acquaintance, the car had run out of gas while traveling on a forest road behind the local mill. The acquaintance left to walk back to town and Thomas had decided to stay with the car. The car was located on the forest road but Thomas Jones was not located.

Case reference: 2005001799.CaseDesc: On June 1, 1975, the body of an older adult female was located on the west bank of the Niagara River, in the town of Niagara-on-the-Lake. She is believed to be the same person who was witnessed jumping into the Horseshoe Falls on February 17, 1975. She is thought to be 40 plus years, short and heavy-set, with brown hair. She suffered from lung disease and had severe arthritis of her lumbar spine, which may have been painful. When witnessed going over the Falls, she was wearing a long overcoat, possibly grey, and carrying a green umbrella. There is no confirmation that the jumper and the deceased are the same person, however the general descriptions are in agreement. The condition of her remains suggest that she had been in the water for weeks to months.

Teeth: This female probably had a partial dental plate and still retained a gold crown on her right upper canine tooth.

Case reference: 2014003128.CaseDesc: Olimpia Mikszan was last seen on the morning of June 21, 1996, outside her residence in Abbotsford, British Columbia.  She was living alone in a rental suite.  Her vehicle and nearly all of her personal belongings were left at her residence.  Olimpia had just completed high school.  Olimpia was born in Poland, speaks fluent Polish and has a slight Polish accent when speaking English.

Case reference: 2018059144.CaseDesc: On October 9, 2018, Johnathan Braithwaite was seen for the last time as he was leaving the CIBC bank located on 45 King Street, in St. Catharines, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Johnathan was despondent.

Scar: Torso (Front), Scar from two gunshot wounds

Case reference: 2020041548.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2020, Horacio Calderon Alvidrez was last seen moving out from his residence in New Westminster, British Columbia. Horacio has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2013000036.CaseDesc: Pierre Roy was last seen on January 28, 1983.  He was involved in an altercation in a bar in Montreal and has not been seen since.

Teeth: Braces, Wears 2 dentures, the top one is welded
Scar: Right Leg, 2 scars on each side of 5" long

Case reference: 2020008364.CaseDesc: On December 19, 1982, at approximately 10:30 am, Simon Yefronovich was seen for the last time by his friend as he left his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Simon was scheduled to fly to Vancouver, British Columbia, with his friend, but he never boarded the flight.

Case reference: 2012020056.CaseDesc: Sylvia Ann Guiboche was last seen around mid June 2003.  Sylvia is known to frequent the Sargent Avenue/Ellice Avenue area of Winnipeg, Manitoba.  Sylvia is at high risk of being exploited.

Other: Abdomen, Was 6-9 months pregnant at time of disappearance

Case reference: 2014003835.CaseDesc: Janice Howe left her family home in the Fort Garry area driving her father's 1985 Oldsmobile Cierra, and has not been seen since. Ms. Howe's vehicle was located the following morning 19 km east of Kenora, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016060399.CaseDesc: On October 3, 1975, the skeletal remains of a male were found in the brush on Sparrow Lake Road (Lot 23 Con 14) in Orillia. His post-mortem length was recorded as being between 5'8"-5'9" however; this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  A pair of nail clippers was also found nearby. His death is estimated to have occurred in the spring or summer prior.

Teeth: No dental work, missing a few teeth in upper jaw.
Shoes: Brown leather clog-type shoes with a raised Cuban heel, size 7-8
Scarf: Orange, Knitted gold-coloured material, possibly a scarf or sweater
Underwear: White, Undershirt with label, partial initials "MP" followed by "LAN", beneath these "PETTIN"
Tie: Red, white, and blue material with curved design - possibly a necktie or head band

Case reference: 2013000074.CaseDesc: Pasquale Giannetti has been missing from Montreal since November 26, 1984. His vehicle was located at L'Ile Ste-Hélène and his clothes were found on the Jacques Cartier Bridge.

Case reference: 2014005752.CaseDesc: On the early morning of March 31, 2007, Candace Shpeley was last seen in Chilliwack, British Columbia. There is reason to believe that Ms. Shpeley, a resident of Abbotsford, British Columbia, was travelling from a friend’s residence on the day of her disappearance. Her vehicle, a 1995 green Pontiac Grand Am, was recovered near the Renfrew sky train station in Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2006011299.CaseDesc: Henry Atlookan left Whiteclay Lake in a canoe to travel 55 km to Armstrong, Ontario. He may have been seen on June 25, 1968 making a purchase at a local store in the Town of Armstrong. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 1994001630.CaseDesc: On November 26, 1988, Amber Potts was seen for the last time in Etobicoke, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Amber was staying in a hotel room and was living a high-risk lifestyle. All her personal belongings were left in her hotel room.

Case reference: 2009004199.CaseDesc: Manou Sokpor was reported missing to police by his fiancée. She had last spoken with Manou at 2:00 a.m. on May 14th, 2009 by telephone; nothing seemed out of the ordinary. His fiancée had no further contact with Manou the rest of that day which was out of his character. On May 15th the vehicle Manou usually drove was located in his driveway, and his wallet and cellular phone were in the bedroom.

Teeth: Visible Missing, First or second molar upper left jaw, gap in front teeth.

Case reference: 2014004744.CaseDesc: Cyril Detimmerman and a friend left Brandon, Manitoba on the Assiniboine River traveling to Treherne. Cyril was experienced at navigating along this river route, however water conditions at that time had been very high as a result of the spring flooding. The pair soon encountered strong currents and large amounts of debris on the river. In the process of trying to navigate to shore the boat capsized causing both men to enter the water. Both men were wearing life jackets. Extensive searches conducted by land, air, water and dragging operations several miles along the river all with negative results. Mr. Detimmerman was never found and is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014003746.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1972, Mario Cardinal was reported missing by his family. At the time of his disappearance, he lived in Trois-Rivières, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014005578.CaseDesc: On August 27, 1980, Alexander Calder was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. Mr. Calder was transient in nature, and frequented social service agencies in the downtown area of Edmonton. He was also known to frequent Edmonton’s river valley, and is described as having a cognitive impairment.

Case reference: 2021008285.CaseDesc: Trenton Phillips was last seen by a family member at their residence in Red Deer, Alberta in the summer of 2017.  Trenton told the family member he was going to Kenya in Africa with Lifewater to build wells.

Case reference: 2012020016.CaseDesc: Rhody Lake disappeared on Sunday, November 27, 2005.  She was last seen going for a walk in Sechelt's Porpoise Bay Provincial Park located in Sechelt, B.C.

Hat: Red, Orange, Toque - might be beige

Case reference: 2006014099.CaseDesc: Lee Kerton was reported missing when he failed to return from a fishing trip on September 17, 1977, on Wakomata Lake in Ontario, Casson Township.

Case reference: 2014000005.CaseDesc: Kenneth Chester FEHR was last seen on November 27th, 2012 at approximately 5:30 PM in the 1700 block of Idylwyld Drive North, Saskatoon, SK. He left behind his wallet and cell phone. Prior to leaving he told numerous family and friends good bye. He also spoke of harming himself.

Hair: Blonde, Wavy, Dirty blonde wavy hair down past his shoulders
Pants: Cotton, Grey, Sweat pants. Work clothes stained with tar
Shirt: Cotton, Black, Work clothes stained with tar.  Could be grey in colour

Case reference: 2011762660.CaseDesc: Brittany Stalman was last seen on Crawford Drive, Delta, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2012020044.CaseDesc: On December 23, 1986, Rodney Sloat was seen for the last time, by his friends, in Strathcona County, Alberta. That evening, Rodney was having dinner at his friends’ residence, and had left on his snowmobile at approximately midnight. During the time of his disappearance, Rodney may have been despondent. All of his personal belongings, identification, and snowmobile were found at his residence.

Case reference: 2016013379.CaseDesc: On March 16, 2016, at approximately 4:00 a.m., Gilberto Cardinal-Fernandes was seen for the last time when he left his apartment to go for a walk in Gatineau, Quebec. Gilberto left without taking any of his personal belongings, and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Brown, Shoulder, Worn in long Dreadlocks, long brown beard

Case reference: 2014004844.CaseDesc: On September 30, 2006, Aaron Derbyshire, was seen for the last time in the early morning hours in downtown Kelowna, British Columbia.  Aaron, a long term resident of Kelowna, had spent the evening out with friends after a day's work as a local surveyor.

Case reference: 2014005223.CaseDesc: On March 4th, 2009, Wesley Foulds , 52, left his Abbotsford residence for an appointment in New Westminster.  Mr. Foulds didn't arrive for his appointment, and didn't show up for work later that day.  Mr. Foulds' vehicle was discovered the next day parked near the Hayward Dam in Mission BC.

Case reference: 2014005411.CaseDesc: On August 27, 1992, around 4:00 pm, Bernard Robitaille left St. Charles Boromée hospital after refusing treatment. He left on foot and has never been seen since. At the time of his disappearance he was carrying a Metro grocery plastic bag containing his personal belongings. The name and address of Mr. Robitaille was written on the bag.

Scar: Forehead, top of the right eye

Case reference: 2014004201.CaseDesc: Rodney Hicks was last seen at his residence at 1700hrs on March 3, 1989. Mr. Hicks has an intellectual disability. He suffered from epilepsy and autism.

Case reference: 2014001191.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2010, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Richelieu River in Saint-Mathias-sur-Richelieu, Quebec. In his possession were a Hipstreet brand MP3 player and headphones. The images shown are facial approximation portraits of this unidentified man created by the Sûreté du Québec.

Case reference: 2014004453.CaseDesc: On January 29, 2004, Samuel Samuelson was seen for the last time while driving a snowmobile by the lake on Bizard Island toward Deux Montagnes in Montreal, Quebec. The ice collapsed and Samuel and his snowmobile fell into the water.

Jewelry: Gold, Chain with razor blade pendant
Gold, Bracelet worn on right wrist

Case reference: 2012020138.CaseDesc: The 18 month old Yohanna went missing after the mother entrusted the custody of her daughter to her boyfriend while she was out of town for a few days. They all lived in the Saint Laurent area in Montreal. Upon her return to Montreal, the mother was told that her baby was in Washington with the boyfriend’s mother. She went to the United States to find her daughter, but could not locate her. Returning to Quebec, the mother alerted the police of her child’s disappearance. The boyfriend claimed then that the child drowned in the bathtub during the mother’s absence and that she had been buried before the mother’s return. He was questioned and then released due to lack of evidence.

Case reference: 2014002240.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1993, Marcus Laing was reported missing when he failed to show up for work which was out of character for him.

Case reference: 2012020090.CaseDesc: In 1993, a human foot and running shoe were located along the North Saskatchewan River near Prince Albert, SK, approximately 1 km west of the river forks. The foot was examined by the University of Saskatchewan Department of Archaeology. It was determined to be that of a robust male, size 10, big boned, and athletic, likely between the ages of 30 and 60.

Case reference: 2014006556.CaseDesc: On the 23rd of July, 2006, Preston WALDNER was swimming at Paradise Beach, South Saskatchewan River, when he and another fellow were attempting to swim across the river. The boys got part way across when they ran into trouble due to the very strong current of the river. The one fellow was pulled from the river and survived, however Mr. WALDNER was seen going under and he never resurfaced. A search was conducted but Mr. WALDNER has not been located.

Tattoo: Left Chest, Howling wolf with the initial "PWW" above the wolf

Case reference: 2014001627.CaseDesc: On May 25, 1990, Robert Henson was seen for the last time riding his horse along the river in the Hummingbird Falls and Creek area in Rocky Mountain House, Alberta. While riding his horse, Robert was swept down the river.

Case reference: 2014004805.CaseDesc: Patrick Ratto was reported missing from his Burnaby residence July 27, 2006. There have been no confirmed sightings of Mr. Ratto since his disappearance. Mr. Ratto previously resided in Quebec and may have moved back. The Burnaby RCMP would like to speak with anyone who has any information on Mr. Ratto's whereabouts.

Hair: Brown, Short, Small brown & grey goatee
Jacket: Black, White, Windbreaker with white markings and a logo

Case reference: 2013000094.CaseDesc: Robert Beauchamp was last seen in Montreal on June 22, 1993. He left his home with friends and was never seen again.

Case reference: 2014004988.CaseDesc: Margaret Blackbird was last seen in Loon Lake, Saskatchewan in 1951. It had been suspected that Ms. Blackbird left for either Alberta or British Columbia; however, she made no further contact with her family. Inquiries to locate Ms. Blackbird in Alberta and British Columbia have been unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2020051730.CaseDesc: On Dec 10, 2020, Gurpreet Singh Parmar was last seen on a video surveillance camera walking away from his family residence in Abbotsford, British Columbia.  Gurpreet has not been seen or heard from since.

Backpack: Other, Lunch bag or Lunch pail with shoulder strap
Hat: Other, Possibly wearing a brimmed hat
Pants: Other, Possibly wearing dark pants or sweatpants
Sweater: Other, Dark coloured sweater, hoodie or jacket, possibly red

Case reference: 2014004122.CaseDesc: Maria Evangelista was last seen on January 27, 1997, in Montreal. Maria had called her mother to tell her that she no longer wanted to return to the hospital and would like to work in California. Maria's luggage was found in a hotel, in San Francisco, on February 7, 1997.

Case reference: 2014006175.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2013, at approximately 5:30 a.m., Jason Bathily and his twin sister, Clarene Bathily, were seen for the last time with their mother, Adelyne Mounga, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2021057203.CaseDesc: Liam Askin was reported missing by family on December 10, 2021. He was last seen at the east Banff Park gates on November 15, 2020. Liam has significant mental and physical illnesses. There have been no confirmed footprints of life since.

Case reference: 2014005821.CaseDesc: Jacques Joseph Duguay was reported missing on May 31, 1982. On May 25th, 1982, his vehicle, a 1975 Chev 1/2 ton pickup was towed from Berry Mills Highway just outside Moncton, NB. The vehicle had been there since May 21st, 1982.

Case reference: 2014003896.CaseDesc: On February 22, 2002, at approximately 3:30 p.m., Johanne Couture was seen for the last time when she left the Hôtel-Dieu Hospital in Lévis, Quebec. The following day, Johanne’s purse was found in the Chaudière Falls Park in Lévis.

Case reference: 2019000913.CaseDesc: On January 1, 2019, Daniel Hill was seen for the last time in Medicine Hat, Alberta.

Case reference: 2021022385.CaseDesc: On May 28, 2021, Kienan Tran was reported missing from his residence in West St. Paul, Manitoba. In May, a representative from property management entered Kienan’s residence and noticed that it was vacant. Additional details revealed that Kienan was engaged in a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2015065844.CaseDesc: On December 3, 2015, at approximately 2: 00am, David Howlett was seen for the last time in his home in Paradise, Newfoundland.  David’s car was later located in the area of Cape Spear in St. John’s, Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2008023399.CaseDesc: Christine Ziomkiewicz was last seen on June 23, 1978, by co-workers at Queen's University, where she worked as a laboratory technician. Her vehicle was still in the building’s parking lot and there was nothing to indicate she had left intentionally for any period of time. She is not believed to have been in a relationship at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2006001999.CaseDesc: On March 28, 1993, an unidentified man was discovered close to the CP railway tracks near Royal York road and Dundas Street in Toronto, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts that he was of East Asian ancestry.

Teeth: Had natural teeth with no dental work
Jeans: Denim, Blue, second pair - was wearing two pairs of jeans
Jacket: Nylon, Dark Blue, winter jacket with a zipper and a hood

Case reference: 2014005378.CaseDesc: On September 8, 2004, Robert Harrington was last seen near the intersection of Oakwood Avenue and Vaughan Road in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2019042986.CaseDesc: On August 14, 1987, at approximately 8:15am, Anna Lippert was last seen at the Etobicoke General Hospital in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2017013180.CaseDesc: On March 1, 2017, at approximately 9:00 p.m., Maryam Mehrvarz and Kian Norouzian were seen last seen together in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004316.CaseDesc: Trevor Angell was last heard from on September 22, 2000. Mr. Angell is a truck driver who was taking a load from Calgary, Alberta to Los Angeles, California.  His truck was located on September 25, 2000 in Primm, Nevada, USA.

Case reference: 2014026082.CaseDesc: On August 24, 2014, Francois Montcalm was seen for the last time when he left the family residence riding his vintage blue Peugeot Bicycle.

Case reference: 2012020013.CaseDesc: Angeline Pete was last seen on May 26, 2011 leaving her residence in North Vancouver, BC.  Miss Pete's disappearance is suspicious and foul play cannot be excluded.

Hair: Brown, Long, Dyed, Often dyes it

Case reference: 2016068704.CaseDesc: On June 7, 1966, a female was recovered from the water near Amherstburg. Death is believed to have occurred within a few hours to a couple of days prior to recovery.

Teeth: Other, She wore upper and lower complete dentures.
Other: American .25 cent piece in the pocket and a key pinned to the right side of her dress.
Shoes: black cloth with white rubber soles; size 6.5
Dress: Black, pullover with floral pattern, matching belt and a white button
Scar: Left Chest, 7.5 cm semicircular scar on her upper left breast
Left Upper Arm, 2 cm vaccination scar
Front Of Neck, 8 cm thyroidectomy scar
Mark: Right Eye, 2 x 0.8 cm xanthelasma on her right lower eyelid

Case reference: 2008022299.CaseDesc: On Friday August 15, 2008, a male was recovered from the waters of the Detroit River, floating along the western shore of Fighting Island. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 146 lbs; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He is thought to have been in the water for a few days to a couple of weeks.

Hair: Black, Curly, Short, Signs of greying and a beard
Teeth: Visible Missing, He had lost all of his teeth in life, but it is likely that he wore dentures.
Pants: Grey, Sweatpants, Label back seam Donald Duck face and "Iceberg Jeans" label back pocket with Mickey Mouse face.
Shirt: Blue, Longsleeve, "Massini" brand long sleeved checkered shirt, size large

Case reference: 2012020071.CaseDesc: Richard Tssessaze's last known residence was in Brandon, Manitoba.  He had previously lived in both Thompson and lac Brochet.  Mr. Tssessaze was last seen in downtown Winnipeg in the area of the St. Regis Hotel, located on Smith Street, in late June of 2009.  Since that time, Mr. Tssessaze has not been seen or heard from, and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2008018099.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1974, at approximately 8:15 hours, Douglas Henderson and Alexander Korecki were canoeing in a 14 foot fiberglass canoe close to the shore in the area of Depot Harbor, Big Sound, in Georgian Bay. The canoe capsized approximately 500 feet away from the campsite.
